result.execSummary:
The defendant Allie A. Kropp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To jail sentence in Count 2 of 22CF19

miscConds.notes: Payment of costs + fees + DNA surcharge + DV surcharge = $703.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today without a valid prescription. 
No entry into any bars, taverns or other places that serve alcohol as a principal business.
No contact with S.C..
No contact with M.H. without prior agent approval.

Full compliance with the DJA on Count 1 of 22CF19.
Any medications, including those prescribed, must have prior agent approval.
May take any medications necessary during labor of child.
Substance Abuse evaluation and follow through.
Mental Health evaluation and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
Must fully cooperate with the Child Support Agency.
DNA sample due 10-12-2022.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
